content.body: Very niche question about Web Components. (Not sure if there's a better channel). Has there ever been a discussion about a kind of :is() in CSS for targeting a custom element and all its derived custom elements? Say you define ui-a and derive ui-b and ui-c from that and need a global CSS rule that targets all of them, but you don't want to just :is() them as others might add more later without searching/modifying every rule.
sirisian: the custom element could define some kind of :state() thing you could match on (in the future)
content.formatted_body: sirisian: the custom element could define some kind of :state() thing you could match on (in the future)

content.body: Was thinking more of an :is-a() check, but using a state would work.
